triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: The paper studies emergent behaviors in populations of large language models as the primary subjects of experimentation.

triples.name: Social norm
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that social conventions (a type of social norm) can emerge spontaneously in LLM populations without explicit programming.

triples.name: Shared information bias
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the emergence of collective bias in agent populations, which relates to how group members process shared versus unshared information.

triples.name: Natural language
triples.relevance: The paper uses natural language as the communication medium through which LLM agents coordinate and establish social conventions.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: The paper studies autonomous artificial intelligence agents operating in decentralized populations to understand emergent collective behaviors.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper examines multi-agent systems composed of LLMs to understand how populations of interacting agents develop social conventions.

triples.name: AI alignment
triples.relevance: The paper addresses implications for designing AI systems that align with human values and remain aligned through decentralized social coordination mechanisms.
